alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Curry County; De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:25PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN ROOSEVELT, EASTERN DE BACA, CENTRAL CHAVES, SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND SOUTHWESTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 224 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of House to 19 miles northwest of Kenna to 11 miles southwest of Roswell. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roswell, Dexter, Hagerman, Melrose, Elida, Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge, Elkins, Taiban, Tolar and Kenna. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 85 and 123. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 331 and 367. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 156 and 199. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Curry County; De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
